intro: Carpodinus lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceolate spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its simple, lance-shaped leaves and small, inconspicuous yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with latex-producing properties. The plant's botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
